perturbation.original_text:
2. Section 6.0 ("Payment") of the Agreement is modified by adding the following new Section 6.7:
6.7 [*****]
perturbation.changed_text:
2. Section 6.0 ("Payment") of the Agreement is modified by adding the following new Section 6.7:
6.7 Invoices must be paid within 30 days of the invoice date.

6.8 Notwithstanding Section 6.7, invoices may be paid within 45 days of the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the payment deadline. Section 6.7 states invoices must be paid within 30 days, while Section 6.8 allows for 45 days, creating ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the correct payment term. This could lead to disputes over late payment fees and contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if
no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list)
shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the
preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under
this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be
entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival"
and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the
Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any
price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").
perturbation.changed_text:
12.1 Distributor shall have the option to return to Cisco, for credit, up [*****] of the dollar value of Products from the Wholesale Price List (or, if
no Wholesale Price Lists exists for Distributor's Territory, then the applicable price list)
shipped to Distributor, net of credits, less returns to Cisco, in the preceding [*****] period (the "Balancing Cap") of the
preceding Cisco fiscal quarter. The above-referenced cap shall be determined based on all Product purchases made under
this Agreement. The responsibility to manage the Balancing Cap shall rest solely upon Distributor. Distributor shall be
entitled to return Product once per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap. "Dead on Arrival"
and Obsolete Products returned pursuant to Section 13 of this Agreement shall be excluded from calculation of the
Balancing Cap. Cisco shall credit Distributor's account in the amount of the price paid by Distributor therefore, less any
price protection credits issued to Distributor related to the Product returned (the "Return Credit").

12.3. Notwithstanding section 12.1, Distributor is entitled to return products twice per quarter, provided such returns do not exceed the Balancing Cap.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an inconsistency regarding the number of product returns allowed per quarter. Section 12.1 states that the Distributor is entitled to return product once per quarter, whereas section 12.3 states that the distributor is allowed twice per quarter, leading to a conflict. The difference leads to uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
5.0 All capitalized terms not defined in this Amendment No. 3 shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. In the event of conflict
between the terms of this Amendment No. 3 and the Agreement, the terms of this Amendment No. 3 shall prevail. All other terms and conditions of
the Agreement remain unchanged.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.0 All capitalized terms not defined in this Amendment No. 3 shall have the meaning assigned to them in the Agreement. In the event of conflict
between the terms of this Amendment No. 3 and the Agreement, the terms of the Agreement shall prevail. All other terms and conditions of
the Agreement remain unchanged.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that in case of conflict between the amendment and the agreement, the terms of the amendment prevail. The changed text now states that the terms of the agreement prevail. This is a direct contradiction that would completely alter how the contract is interpreted and enforced.
